headline: The Breath of God
description: A quiet psalm on divine presence within silence. The poem treats stillness not as absence but as the living interval where the sacred reenters the heart through breath, bird, and Word.

motifMap.meaning: Breath as spirit ‚Äî the subtle motion of divine life through stillness
Messenger of the ordinary sacred ‚Äî nature‚Äôs hymn to the divine
Scripture and revelation as vessel of the breath
Healing space between griefs; not absence but recovery
